page.title: 06CHARLTON-HANK.LANDSCAPE 1
page.content: { LANDSCAPE} This land is a patchwork of verdant areas,woods,and hedges and,as{ {Hankerton}is "green belt"and{Charlton} a conservation area, building is restricted. BUILDINGS.Interesting old buildings are:{VILLAGE FARMHOUSE}in Charlton which is a 17th century house with three steep gables with small horizontal windows in them.Five bays and two storeys below with stone cross-windows.No projection.The old farm buildings at the rear have been converted to dwelling houses.{ {EASTCOURT HOUSE}on the Northern boundary of the area was built in the 17th century. The regularly placed windows have stone crosses and the projecting left wing has mullioned windows.In the right,18th c. wing is a fine drawing room,decoration c.1750.
